of this is that the intro part couldn't be created...

Micheal, having : 
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:org.eclipse.ui.intro.config.CustomizableIntroP
art  

in the log file makes me suspecious!
Can you tell me again what you did? I tried this:
Open Intro.
Double click on Intro view to put in standby,
Shutdown and restart.
Intro comes up in standby ok.

N20050503 build.

I suspect his launches were messed up.   This was in a runtime workspace... creating a new launch 
caused the problem to go away.

I think the actual cause of the problem is a muckup in the PDE tools... not sure what.  What's more 
interesting is that we aren't throwing a part init excepting in the init() method when there's an issue in 
creating the intro part.  We shouldn't be silently eating that error.

Kim,
for the PDE hick-up, PDE sometimes goes out of synch with cached info and you 
have tomake sure you select "clear configuration area..." in the 
configuratuion tab before thing start working again. 
Maybe thats what happened with Michael.
*** Bug 90758 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I've tried creating a new launcher and also clearing configuration in an existing workspace and I cannot get around this bug. Any ideas?

My log file contents is:
